```{python}
#| label: fig-switched-capacitor
#| echo: false
#| fig-cap: "An switched capacitor for use in an oscillator switched capacitor tuning bank. The bias resistors tie the drain/source nodes to ground during turn on of $M_1$ (for low on resistance), while they tie the drain/source nodes to VDD during turn off of $M_1$ to prevent accidential turn on of the drain/source to bulk diodes of $M_1$."
import schemdraw as sd
import schemdraw.elements as elm
import schemdraw.logic as lgc

sd.svgconfig.svg2 = False

with sd.Drawing(canvas='svg') as d:
    d.config(unit=2, fontsize=14)

    elm.Capacitor().label('$C$', loc='top').right().idot(open=True).dot()
    l1 = elm.Line().right(d.unit/2)
    M1 = elm.AnalogNFet(offset_gate=False, arrow=False).label('$M_1$', loc='right').reverse().anchor('source').theta(270).reverse().drop('drain')
    l2 = elm.Line().right(d.unit/2)
    elm.Capacitor().label('$C$', loc='top').right().idot().dot(open=True)

    R1 = elm.Resistor().at(l1.start).down(d.unit*1.5).label(r'$R_\mathrm{bias}$', loc='top')
    R2 = elm.Resistor().at(l2.end).down(d.unit*1.5).label(r'$R_\mathrm{bias}$', loc='bottom')
    elm.Line().at(R1.end).right().tox(M1.gate).dot()
    d.push()
    lgc.Not().up().to(M1.gate)
    d.pop()
    d.push()
    elm.Line().to(R2.end)
    d.pop()
    lgc.Not().down().reverse()
    elm.Dot(open=True).label('$S$', loc='bottom')
```
